127.01 COMPOSITION.
   Law enforcement officer rank structure of the Vienna Police Department is
composed as follows:
      One Chief
      One Captain
      One Lieutenant
      Five Sergeants
      Thirteen Patrolmen.
   The number of Patrolmen may be increased or decreased hereinafter by
Council, by ordinance or resolution. The Chief of Police may hold the rank of
Captain, Lieutenant, Sergeant or Patrolman concurrently. (Ord. 01-2022. Passed
5-12-22.)
127.02 CIVIL SERVICE.
   There is hereby established a Police Civil Service Commission and the
powers, duties, rules, regulations and other provisions relating to Commission
shall be the same as those provided for in West Virginia Code 8-14-6 et seq.
Such sections of the West Virginia Code are hereby adopted and made a part of
this article by reference and shall be known and designated, as the Police
Civil Service Code.
(1965 Code §16-2)
127.03 PENSION AND RELIEF FUND.
   (a)    Created; Purposes. There is hereby established a Policemen's Pension
and Relief Fund for the purposes set forth and provided by West Virginia Code
8-22-16 et seq.
   (b)    Board of Trustees; Established. There is hereby established a board
of trustees for the Policemen's Pension and Relief Fund who shall administer
and distribute the funds authorized to be raised by West Virginia Code 8-22-16
et seq. as provided by such sections.
   (c)    Board of Trustees; Composition. The board of trustees established by
subsection (b) hereof shall consist of the Mayor and four members of the Police
Department who shall be elected and shall serve as provided by West Virginia
Code 8-22-16 et seq.
(1965 Code §§16-3 to 16-5 )
127.04 SPECIAL SCHOOL ZONE POLICE OFFICERS.
   (a)    Authority to Employ and Appoint. Council is hereby authorized to
employ and appoint three special school zone police officers, pursuant to the
terms and authority of West Virginia Code 8-14-5.
   (b)    Powers and Duties Generally; Supervision. Special police officers
appointed pursuant to this article shall be vested with all the powers of
regular police officers, shall be under the direct supervision of the Mayor and
the Chief of Police to the same extent as regular police officers, and shall
have the duty of controlling and directing traffic at the following designated
locations in the vicinity of schools within the City:
      (1)    The crosswalk on Grand Central Avenue between Twenty-third Street
and Twenty-fourth Street;
      (2)    The crosswalk on Grand Central Avenue at Forty-first Street; and,
      (3)    The crosswalk on Grand Central Avenue at Fifty-seventh Street;
      (4)    The crosswalk on Grand Central Avenue at Fifty-first Street.
   (c)    Display of Badge; Uniform; State Law Provisions. Special police
officers appointed pursuant to this article shall be in uniform and display a
badge or other sign of authority. Such officers shall not come within the Civil
Service provisions of West Virginia Code 8-14-6 et seq. or pension and relief
fund provisions of West Virginia Code 8-22-16 et seq.
   (d)    Qualifications, Training, etc.; Recommendations to Council. The Mayor
and Chief of Police shall provide for the qualifications, testing and training
as they deem necessary to secure capable and responsible persons to fill the
positions of special school zone police officers and submit their
recommendations to Council, as Council shall from time to time require.
   (e)    Filling Vacancies; Term, Salary, Bond and Discharge of Officers.
Council shall have the right, from time to time, by resolution, to fill any
vacancy in the membership of the special school zone police officers; to
discharge any such officer appointed by it; to require the bond provided by
West Virginia Code 8-14-5 and to increase or decrease the amount thereof; and
to fix and change the terms and salaries of the officers.
(1965 Code §§16-6 to 16-10)
ARTICLE 129
Fire Department
 
   EDITOR'S NOTE: By resolution passed July 13, 1978, Council appointed the
current City Fire Chief, who had previously served on a volunteer basis, as the
full time permanent Fire Chief of the City.

Volunteer fire companies - see W. Va. Code 8-15-4 et seq.

1505
 
 
129.01 CREATED.
   To better protect the lives and property of the residents, the Vienna
Volunteer Fire Company is hereby created. Such fire department shall be
referred to in this article as the Fire Department. (1965 Code §8-8)
129.02 OBJECT.
   The object of the Fire Department shall be the prevention of fire and the
preservation and protection of life and property from and during such fires as
may occur.
(1965 Code §8-9 )
129.03 COMPOSITION.
   The Fire Department shall be composed of three departments, as follows:
   (a)    The Bureau of Fire Prevention, as provided for and governed in Part
Fifteen - Fire Prevention Code.
   (b)    A Fire Department consisting of members as provided in the bylaws of
the organization.
   (c)    The Social Department, which may consist of a president, vice-
president, secretary and treasurer, and other officers as may be designated.
      (1965 Code §8-10)
129.04 BYLAWS, RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   The Fire Department shall have the authority to adopt bylaws, rules and
regulations for the government and operation of the Department. Such bylaws,
rules and regulations shall not become effective until approved by Council.
(1965 Code §8-11)
129.05 EQUIPMENT AND APPARATUS GENERALLY.
   The Fire Department shall be equipped with such apparatus and accessories as
may be required, from time to time, to maintain its efficiency.
(1965 Code §8-12)
129.06 ACQUISITION AND MAINTENANCE OF EQUIPMENT.
   The Bureau of Fire Prevention may finance the purchase and maintenance of
apparatus and accessories required by the Fire Department in any manner deemed
proper by the Bureau of Fire Prevention, with the approval of the Fire
Department and Council.
(1965 Code §8-13)
129.07 HOUSING OF EQUIPMENT.
   All of the equipment of the Fire Department shall be safely and conveniently
housed in such stations as may be designated by the Fire Department and the
Bureau of Fire Prevention with the approval of Council. (1965 Code §8-14)
129.08 UNAUTHORIZED USE OR REMOVAL OF EQUIPMENT.
   No person shall use any fire apparatus or equipment for any private purpose,
nor shall any person willfully and without proper authority remove, take away,
keep or conceal any tool, appliance or other article used in any way by the
Fire Department.
(1965 Code §8-15)
129.09 APPOINTMENT, TERM AND REMOVAL OF CHIEF.
   The Fire Chief shall be appointed by Council with the approval of the Fire
Department for an indefinite period of time, and his tenure of office shall
depend upon his good conduct and efficiency. He shall be removed only for just
cause and after a fair and impartial hearing before Council and the Fire
Department.
(1965 Code §8-16)
129.10 POLICE POWER OF DEPARTMENT OFFICERS.
   All officers in charge of the Fire Department are hereby given the necessary
special police power for the purpose of enforcing the provisions of this
article and Part Fifteen - Fire Prevention Code. (1965 Code §8-17 )
129.11 AUTHORITY TO PULL DOWN STRUCTURES.
   The Fire Chief or any other Fire Department officer in charge may direct the
pulling down and destruction of any fence, house or other thing, if during any
fire or emergency such pulling down and destruction is, in the opinion of the
Fire Chief or other officer in charge, necessary for the proper control and
extinguishment of the fire.
(1965 Code §8-18)
129.12 POLICE TO ASSIST FIRE DEPARTMENT.
   All police officers and such other peace officers as are on duty at the time
shall respond to all fire alarms and assist the Fire Department in the
protection of life and property of the residents, and property of the Fire
Department, and in controlling traffic and maintaining order. (1965 Code §8-19)
ARTICLE 130
Vienna Utility Board
130.01   Created.
130.02   Composition and qualifications of Board directors.
130.03   Appointment of Board members.
130.04   Officers; quorum.
130.05   Powers and duties.
130.06   Public Works Director/General Manager.
130.07   Administration.
130.08   Reports.
130.09   Assets and liabilities.
130.10   Amendment/repeal.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Stormwater utility - see S.U. & P.S. Art.
935
      Stormwater management and surface water discharge control - see
         S.U. & P.S. Art.
937
130.01  CREATED.
   The Vienna Water Utility and Sewer Utility shall be terminated and the
controlling Ordinance shall be repealed and rescinded, a Stormwater Utility
shall be established and the Vienna Utility Board shall be created and the
heretofore separate Waterworks Utility and Sewerage Utility of the City,
together with the herein established Stormwater Utility of the City, shall be
combined into a single undertaking (the "System"). The supervision, management,
control and operation of the System shall be vested in the Vienna Utility Board
(the "Utility Board"), hereby created and appointed and functioning as herein
provided.
(Ord. 11-10. Passed 11-10-10.)
130.02  COMPOSITION AND QUALIFICATIONS OF BOARD DIRECTORS.
   The Utility Board shall consist of five (5) Directors. The Chair of the
Utility Board shall be the Member of the Vienna City Council serving as the
liaison to the Public Works Department. One (1) additional member of the
Utility Board shall be a Member of the Vienna City Council. The remaining three
(3) Directors shall be citizens and residents of the City, of outstanding
reputation, ability and integrity. All Directors shall be appointed by the
Council of the City. (Ord. 7-11. Passed 4-28-11.)
130.03 APPOINTMENT OF BOARD MEMBERS.
   The Mayor shall notify all appointees of their appointment. The terms of
such Directors first appointed shall be for 1, 2, 3 and 4 years, respectively,
from the 1st day of the month in which appointed. In the event of a vacancy and
also within 30 days after the expiration of the term of office of any Director,
a successor shall be appointed by Council. All vacancies shall be filled for
the unexpired term only and all other appointments shall be for a term of 4
years, to commence on the date following the scheduled expiration date of the
previous term. The Utility Board shall have power to adopt bylaws, rules and
regulations for its own governance. Any Director shall be eligible for
reappointment upon the expiration of his or her term. The Directors shall each
receive compensation for their services at the rate of fifty dollars ($50.00)
per meeting attended, and shall also be reimbursed for any and all actual
expenses incurred in the performance of duties as ordered by the Utility Board.
(Ord. 11-10. Passed 11-10-10.)
130.04  OFFICERS; QUORUM.
   At the first meeting of the Utility Board and annually thereafter it shall
organize by designating one of the Directors to act as Vice Chairman and by
designating a Secretary and a Treasurer, who need not be members of the Utility
Board. The Secretary and Treasurer may be the same person. The Chairman shall
preside at all meetings when present and shall call special meetings on his or
her own motion, or when requested to do so by any two Directors. The Vice
Chairman shall preside in the absence of the Chairman. Three (3) Directors
shall constitute a quorum, but any action to be taken by the Utility Board must
be approved by not less than 3 Directors. The Secretary shall keep a written
record of the proceedings which shall be available for inspection as other
municipal records. The Treasurer shall receive and disburse the funds of the
System as directed by the Utility Board. In the event that any Director shall
be unable to fulfill the duties of his or her office for a period of 3 months,
a majority of the remainder of the said Directors may declare the office of
such Director vacant and the Council of said City shall thereupon fill such
vacancy as otherwise provided for herein.
(Ord. 11-10. Passed 11-10-10.)
130.05 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   The Utility Board shall have full and complete authority for the
supervision, management, control and operation of the System, including the
maintenance, operations, improvements and extensions thereof. All bills for
water, sewer and stormwater service shall be collected and accounted for by the
Utility Board in the manner and form required by law, the Public Service
Commission of West Virginia and the ordinances of the City, and all
disbursements and accounts of the System shall be ordered paid out only upon
approval of said Utility Board; provided, however, that all such supervision,
management and control of the System and the collection and accounting for
bills for water and sewer service shall be consistent and in accordance with
any ordinances pursuant to which the City may have authorized and issued any
bonds from time to time outstanding, which by their terms are payable from and
secured by the revenues of the System. The Utility Board shall have the power
and authority to make all contracts, agreements and other matters necessary or
proper for the full and complete supervision, management and control of the
System.
(Ord. 11-10. Passed 11-10-10.)
130.06 PUBLIC WORKS DIRECTOR/GENERAL MANAGER.
   The City of Vienna Public Works Director shall serve as the General Manager
of the Utility Board as a joint employee of the City and the Utility Board. The
City Council shall fix the total compensation of the Public Works Director/
General Manager. Compensation for the General Manager shall be paid from the
funds of the Utility Board as a portion of the total compensation of the Public
Works Director/General Manager in equal proportion to the percentage of time
spent on duties of the Utility Board.
(Ord. 11-10. Passed 11-10-10.)
130.07 ADMINISTRATION.
   The Utility Board shall have power to fix and maintain a separate budget,
and employ, fix the compensation of and discharge all other employees of the
System. The Chairman and Treasurer of the Utility Board, upon their appointment
and taking office, shall furnish and file with the City Clerk, a bond in an
amount to be set by the Utility Board from time to time, the cost of such bond
to be payable from revenues of the System and such bond to be payable to the
City and conditioned as to the faithful performance of their respective duties
as are fixed by the Utility Board. (Ord. 11-10. Passed 11-10-10.)
130.08 REPORTS.
   The Utility Board shall provide reports, at least quarterly, or as otherwise
required bylaw, to the Mayor and Council, indicating the System's financial
condition. The Utility Board shall also provide the City with yearly audited
financial statements of the System, minutes of all meetings of the Utility
Board, an annual budget for the System, and other information as may reasonably
be requested.
(Ord. 11-10. Passed 11-10-10.)
130.09  ASSETS AND LIABILITIES.
   All assets and liabilities of the Waterworks System and Sewerage System,
including accounts receivable and accounts payable, and all employees thereof,
shall be under the management and control of the Utility Board. Personnel
policies and practices, and other matters affecting employees of the Utility
Board shall, to the extent practicable and unless otherwise approved by
Council, be the same as those undertaken by the City, subject to the provisions
of Section
130.06 hereof.
(Ord. 11-10. Passed 11-10-10.)
130.10 AMENDMENT/REPEAL.
   The Council of the City enacts this article for the assurance and protection
of the citizens of the City and for the purpose of assuring efficient operation
and maintenance of City infrastructure. No amendment or repeal of this article
shall be enacted unless approved by seventy-five percent (75%) of the members
of Council. Any such amendment or repeal shall otherwise be enacted in
accordance with the rules and regulations of Council.
(Ord. 11-10. Passed 11-10-10.)

131.01 SUPERINTENDENT OF WATER AND SEWER DEPARTMENTS.

Departments is hereby established. .
   (b)    Powers and Duties. The Superintendent of Water and Sewer Departments
shall have and exercise general supervision of the Water and Sewer Departments
of the City.
   (c)    Compensation. The Superintendent of Water and Sewer Departments shall
