Virginia, 1931, as amended.
   (b)   The rate of tax shall be one percent of the sales price, as defined in
section two, article fifteen-b, chapter eleven of the Code of West Virginia,
1931, as amended, of the tangible personal property, custom software or taxable
service purchased.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.04  IMPOSITION OF USE TAX.
   An excise tax is hereby levied and imposed on the use in this City of
tangible personal property, custom software and the results of taxable
services, to be collected and paid to the Tax Commissioner as agent for the
City in the same manner that State Use Tax is collected under article fifteen-
a and article fifteen-b, chapter eleven of the Code of West Virginia, 1931, as
amended. The rate of tax shall be one percent of the purchase price, as defined
in article fifteen-b, chapter eleven of the Code of West Virginia, of the
tangible personal property, custom software or taxable service used within the
City.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.05 CALCULATION OF TAX ON FRACTIONAL PARTS OF A DOLLAR.
   The tax computation under Sections
754.03 and
754.04 shall be carried to the third decimal place and the tax rounded up to
the next whole cent whenever the third decimal place is greater than four, and
rounded down to the lower whole cent whenever the third decimal place is four
or less. The vendor may elect to compute the tax due on a transaction on a per-
item basis or on an invoice basis provided the method elected is consistently
used during the reporting period but the method elected shall be the same as
that used for purposes of computing the state sales or use tax.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.06 STATE AND LOCAL SALES AND USE TAX BASES.
   The taxable base of the taxes imposed by Sections
754.03 and
754.04 shall be identical to the sales and use tax base of this State except as
provided in Section
754.07, unless otherwise prohibited by federal law as required by W.Va. Code
§11-15B-34.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.07 EXCEPTIONS.
   The taxes imposed by this article do not apply to:
   (a)   The sale or use of motor fuel, as defined in section fourteen-c,
article fifteen, chapter eleven of the Code of West Virginia, 1931, as amended,
upon which the tax imposed by that article is collected (11-15-14c).
   (b)   The sale or use of motor vehicles upon which the tax imposed by
section three-c, article fifteen, chapter eleven of the Code of West Virginia,
1931, as amended, is paid (11-15-3c).
   (c)   The purchase of any exempt drugs, durable medical goods, mobility
enhancing equipment and prosthetic devices, as set out in West Virginia Code
section nine-i, article fifteen, chapter eleven (11-15-9i).
   (d)   The sale or use of food and food ingredients as set out in section
three-a, article fifteen, chapter eleven (11-15-3a). Provided however,
commensurate with West Virginia Code section three-b, article fifteen, chapter
eleven, (11-15-3b) taxes imposed by Article
754 will apply to prepared food, food sold through vending machines and soft
drinks defined in article fifteen-b, chapter eleven of the West Virginia Code
and will continue to be taxed at the general rate set out in Sections
754.03 or
754.04 as may apply.
   (e)   The purchase or use of any tangible personal property, custom software
or service that the City is prohibited from being taxed under the laws of this
State.
   (f)   The exceptions specifically enumerated in subdivision six, subsection-
k, section five-a, article one, chapter eight (8-1-5a(k)(6)).
   (g)   Any other exception specifically set out in article fifteen, chapter
eleven of the West Virginia Code.
   (h)   The tax imposed by Section
754.03 does not apply to any transaction that is exempt from the tax imposed by
article fifteen, chapter eleven of the West Virginia Code.
   (i)   The tax imposed by Section
754.04 does not apply to any purchase upon which the tax imposed by Section
754.03 has been paid.
      (Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.08 LOCAL RATE AND BOUNDARY CHANGES.
   (a)   The Tax Commissioner is required by W.Va. Code §11-15B-35 to maintain
a database for all jurisdictions levying a sales or use tax in this State. The
City shall furnish the Commissioner with information the Commissioner requires
for that database that will allow the Commissioner a database that assigns each
five-digit and nine-digit zip code within the City to the proper rate of tax.
If any nine-digit zip code area includes an area outside this City, the single
state and local rate assigned to that area in the Commissioner’s database will
be the lowest rate applicable to that area; provided, that, when sales occur at
and are sourced to a physical location of the seller located in the City in
that nine-digit zip code area, the seller shall collect the tax imposed by
Section
754.03.
   (b)   Whenever boundaries of the City change, whether by annexation or de-
annexation, the Office of the Finance Director shall promptly notify the Tax
Commissioner in writing of the change in boundaries and provide the Tax
Commissioner with the nine-digit zip code or codes for the area annexed or de-
annexed and any other information the Tax Commissioner may require to maintain
the database.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.09 STATE LEVEL ADMINISTRATION.
   (a)   The Tax Commissioner is responsible for administering, collecting and
enforcing the taxes imposed by this article as provided in W.Va. Code §8-13C-
6 and § 11-15B-33. The City may enter into an agreement with the Tax
Commissioner to allow employees of the City who are conducting an audit of a
vendor with a physical location in the City for compliance with the City’s
Business and Occupation Tax to also audit that location for compliance with the
sales and use tax laws of this State and this City, and share that information
with the Tax Commissioner.
   (b)   The Tax Commissioner may retain from collections of the taxes imposed
by this article a fee of up to five percent (5%) of the amount of the taxes
collected by the Commissioner prior to the effective date of the legislative
rule setting the fee pursuant to W.Va. Code §11-10- 11c. The fee retained from
taxes collected on and after that date shall be the fee allowed by W.Va. Code
§11-10-11c or by any other State law or legislative rule.
   (c)   The Tax Commissioner shall deposit all the proceeds from collection of
the taxes imposed by this article, minus any fee for collecting, enforcing and
administering taxes retained under Section
754.10, in the subaccount for this City established in “municipal sales and
service tax and use tax fund,” an interest-bearing account created in the State
Treasury pursuant to W.Va. Code §8-13C-7. All moneys collected and deposited in
the subaccount for the City shall be remitted at least quarterly by the State
Treasurer to the City Treasurer, as provided in W.Va. Code §8-13C-7.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.10 ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEDURES.
   Each and every provision of the West Virginia Tax Procedure and
Administration Act set forth in article ten, chapter eleven of the Code of West
Virginia applies to the administration, collection and enforcement of the sales
and use taxes imposed pursuant this article, except as otherwise expressly
provided in article thirteen-c, chapter eight of the Code of West Virginia,
with like effect as if that act were applicable only to the taxes imposed by
this article and were set forth in extenso in this article, as provided in
W.Va. Code § 8-13C-6.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.11 CRIMINAL PENALTIES.
   Each and every provision of the West Virginia Tax Crimes and Penalties Act
set forth in article nine, chapter eleven of the Code of West Virginia applies
to the administration, collection and enforcement of the sales and use taxes
imposed pursuant to this article with like effect as if that act were
applicable only to the taxes imposed pursuant to this article and were set
forth in extenso in this article, as provided in W.Va. Code § 8-13C-6;
provided, that the criminal penalties imposed upon conviction for a criminal
violation of this article may not exceed the maximum penalties allowed by law
for that violation.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.12 AUTOMATIC UPDATING.
   Any amendments to article nine, ten, fifteen, fifteen-a and fifteen-b,
chapter eleven of the Code of West Virginia shall automatically apply to a
sales or use tax imposed pursuant to this article, to the extent applicable, as
provided in W.Va. Code § 8-13C-6.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.13 SALES AND USE TAXES TO BE DEPOSITED DIRECTLY IN THE GENERAL FUND.
   All revenues received from collection of the City’s sales and use taxes,
including any interest, additions to tax and penalties deposited with the City
Treasurer shall be treated by any person to be a general revenue of the City
and shall be deposited directly in the City’s general fund.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
754.14 EFFECTIVE DATE.
   (a)   The ordinance from which this article derives shall take effect from
its adoption by City Council upon second reading. Upon its adoption, the City
Attorney shall forthwith provide the Tax Commissioner with a certified copy of
this ordinance along with a description of the boundaries of the City, the
nine-digit zip codes for addresses located within the boundaries of the City
and such other information as the Tax Commissioner may need to administer,
collect and enforce the taxes imposed this article.
   (b)   Notwithstanding the fact that the ordinance from which this article
derives is effective upon its adoption, collection by vendors of the taxes
imposed by this article and payment of those taxes by purchasers is initially
suspended and shall begin and first apply to sales and purchases made on and
after the first day of the calendar quarter that begins at least 60 days after
the Tax Commissioner first notifies vendors, as provided in W.VA. Code §11-15B-
35, of the adoption of this ordinance and their obligation to collect and remit
the taxes imposed by this article, except that both collection and payment of
the tax on sales made by catalogue is initially suspended and shall first apply
to sales and purchases made by catalogue on and after the first day of the
calendar quarter that begins at least 120 days after vendors making catalogue
sales are first notified, as provided in W.Va. Code §11-15B-35, of the adoption
of the ordinance from which this article derives and their obligation to
collect and remit the taxes imposed by this article. All businesses selling
tangible personal property or furnishing services subject to the tax imposed by
this article on and after the first day of the calendar quarter on which
collection begins shall, on and after that day, collect and remit the taxes
imposed by this article whether or not they received notice from the Tax
Commissioner under W.Va. Code §11-15B-35. In the event that the municipal
boundaries are expanded and newly annexed properties or businesses are brought
into the City, the same 60 day notice applies.
(Ord. 13-14. Passed 12-18-14.)
ARTICLE 757
Contractors
 
757.01   Names and addresses of subcontractors.   
757.02   Failure to comply.
757.03   Forms.
757.04   Definitions.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
West Virginia Contractor Licensing Act - see W. Va. Code Art. 21-11
 
 
757.01 NAMES AND ADDRESSES OF SUBCONTRACTORS.
   Effective October 1, 1990, and thereafter, all general contractors, as the
same is defined herein, shall be required to furnish to the City Auditor names
and addresses of all subcontractors performing work in the City for any such
general contractor. The names and addresses of the subscontractors must be
furnished in writing to the City Auditor and must be either hand delivered or
postmarked on or before the fifteenth day of the month following the close of
the quarter for Business and Occupation tax filing purposes, to wit - January
15, April 15, July 15 and October 15.
(Passed 9-27-90.)
757.02 FAILURE TO COMPLY.
   Any general contractor failing to comply with the provisions of this article
shall, upon conviction thereof, be subject to fine or penalty in the sum of ten
dollars ($10.00) per day for each day the names and addresses of its
subcontractors have not been so furnished as provided herein. In the event the
general contractor fails to supply the names and addresses of its
subcontractors as required herein on or before January 31, April 30, July 31 or
October 31, as the case may be, such general contractor violating the
provisions of this article shall not be entitled to receive any building
permits until the requirements of this article are fully complied with.
(Passed 9-27-90.)
757.03 FORMS.
   The City Auditor is hereby directed and authorized to prepare any and all
forms necessary to effectuate the provisions of this article and to prescribe
such rules and regulations regarding the administration of the provisions of
this article.
(Passed 9-27-90.)
757.04 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purposes of this article:
   (a)   "General contractor" means any person, firm, corporation or
partnership engaged in the business of performing for others, contracts for the
constructing, repairing, decorating or improving of new or existing buildings
or other structures under, upon or above real property either for the entire
work or a specific portion thereof.
   (b)   "Subcontractor" means any person, firm, corporation or partnership
engaged in the business of performing a like or similar service for persons
other than consumers either for the entire work or for a specific portion
thereof.
   (c)   "General contractor" and "subcontractor" include persons, firms,
corporations or partnerships performing labor and services in respect of the
moving of earth or clearing of land, razing or moving of existing buildings or
structures even though such services may not be done in connection with a
contract involving the constructing, repairing or altering of a new or existing
building or structure.
      (Passed 9-27-90.)
ARTICLE 761
Municipal Licenses
761.01   Definitions.
761.02   Payment and term of license.
761.03   Fees to constitute debts due the City.
761.04   Applicability; nontransferability.
761.05   Effect of imposition of license fee.
761.06   Acts prohibited.
761.07   Effect of license.
761.08   Duties and powers of City Treasurer.
761.09   License fees cumulative.
761.10   Change in name or partners.
761.11   Other taxes.
761.12   Display of certificate.
761.13   Fees for trades, professions, occupations, and business activities.
761.14   Fees for owning and operating coin-operated amusement devices or
vending machines.
761.15   Construction; severability.
761.16   False statements prohibited.
761.17   Prosecution; injunctions.
761.18   Effective date.
761.19   Registration of nonlicensed businesses.
761.20   Revocation.
761.21   Regulations.
761.22      General requirements.
761.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
License taxes generally - see W.Va. Code 8-13-4; 11-12-4
 
 
761.01 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   Except as otherwise defined in this article, terms, phrases,
occupations, trades, commercial ventures and terms of art used in sections of
this article other than those referred to in subsection (a) hereof shall have
the meaning give to them in the West Virginia Code, as amended and currently in
force and, when there is more than one such meaning, they shall have the
meaning given in the sections of the West Virginia Code imposing any State
license tax correlative to the City’s license tax.
   (b)   “Business” means any entity that is functioning for remuneration of
any kind, regardless of tenure.
   (c)   “Person” includes, wherever the context will permit, not only natural
persons, but all other legal entities such as partnerships, corporations,
business trusts and the like.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.02 PAYMENT AND TERM OF LICENSE.
   Except as otherwise specified in this article, the entirety of any license
fee designated as an annual fee shall be paid within forty-five days of the
bill being sent. All annual licenses provided for by this article shall be
issued for a term of one year beginning on July 1 and ending on the next
succeeding June 30. Where licenses of other periods are authorized by this
article, they shall be of such duration, and shall begin and end as of such
dates, as the City Treasurer may provide; but the City Treasurer shall select
such dates as State law requires, if any, for any correlative State licenses,
certificates or permits.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.03 FEES TO CONSTITUTE DEBTS DUE THE CITY.
   The fees provided for in this article shall constitute debts due to the City
and may be collected by the City Treasurer by an appropriate action in either
the circuit courts or magistrate courts of West Virginia. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed
2-28-02.)
761.04 APPLICABILITY; NONTRANSFERABILITY.
   (a)   Except where otherwise expressly provided herein, the fees provided
for herein apply to any person undertaking the herein described activities,
trades or professions for any part, no matter how small, of a given time period
in which the fee is imposed. Except where otherwise expressly provided herein,
the licenses provided for in this article are not transferable; that is, the
payment by one person of a license fee provided for in this article shall not
exempt or excuse a purchaser from, a successor to, or assignee of, any such
person from the payment of the prescribed fee for the maintenance or possession
of particular license for the conduct of a particular activity. The licenses
provided for herein are nontransferable personal privileges. The fees provided
for in this article apply only to persons engaging in the specified acts,
having the specified ownership, or carrying on the specified operation or
conduct of a trade or business where the foregoing are located within the
geographic limits of the City. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
   (b)   Before any business license is issued by the City of Vienna for
Contractors and Lawn/landscape providers, the applicant must show that he or
she has successfully completed Storm Water Ordinance Training with the City,
its agent(s), assign(s), or designee(s).
(Ord. 0-1-13. Passed 3-7-13.)
761.05  EFFECT OF IMPOSITION OF LICENSE FEE.
   In every case where this article imposes a license fee, it shall be deemed
that a license is required to perform the activity for each business venture
within the City and that a license can and must be issued by the City Treasurer
with respect to that activity at each location within the City, but only upon
payment of the requisite fee and completion of the requisite application. The
imposition of a license fee by this article shall mean that the payment of the
fee is a prerequisite to the lawful conduct of the activity upon which the fee
is imposed, at each location within the City. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.06 ACTS PROHIBITED.
   Whenever a license fee is imposed by this article, no person shall engage in
the activity or occupation upon which the fee is imposed, nor own or operate
any device upon which the fee is imposed, without first paying the fee and
acquiring the license provided for under this article. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-
28-02.)
761.07 EFFECT OF LICENSE.
   In any case in which a license is required by this article, the issuance of
the license shall be deemed a prerequisite to the lawful conduct of the
activity for which the license is required. Issuance of any license under this
article shall not, however, make valid or legal any act not otherwise valid or
legal or not otherwise authorized by other provisions of law. Nothing in this
article shall authorize any act, activity or ownership not otherwise lawful.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.08 DUTIES AND POWERS OF CITY TREASURER.
   The City Treasurer shall have the power to prepare application forms for any
licenses required under this article. The application may contain questions on
or blanks for any information reasonably deemed necessary by the City
Treasurer. The City Treasurer is expressly authorized to require applicants to
have, and to provide evidence of, a valid and existing West Virginia Business
Franchise Registration Certificate. Proper completion of an application is a
condition precedent to the City Treasurer of a license application and payment
of the requisite fee; the City Treasurer shall issue the requested license to
the applicant. The form of the license and information thereon shall be such as
the City Treasurer may reasonably prescribe. The City Treasurer, or his
designated agent, shall have the power to examine activities and locations of
each business to determine compliance with this article.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.09  LICENSE FEES CUMULATIVE.
   The license fees imposed in this article are cumulative and the imposition
of any one fee does not preclude the imposition of other fees upon any one
individual or business entity. The fees imposed by this article are imposed for
engaging in certain trades or activities, or for the use or possession of
certain devices. The pursuit of a particular trade or activity, or the
ownership or use of a particular device, shall not excuse a person or entity
from the requirement for a license and payment of a license fee for each such
activity or device for which, if engaged in or possessed singly, a license
requirement and license fee would be imposed. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.10 CHANGE IN NAME OR PARTNERS.
   A change in the name under which a person does business shall not require
the person to seek, any new license for any activity licensed under a prior
name; nor shall the withdrawal or addition of partners to a partnership require
the partnership to obtain a new license, provided that the partnership always
retains at least one partner who was a member of the firm at the time the
license was granted. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.11 OTHER TAXES.
   (a)   The City Treasurer may refuse to issue any license required by this
article to any person, firm or corporation delinquent in the payment of any tax
or fee due the City under any ordinance or tariff until such delinquent tax or
fee is paid.
   (b)   Once a business license has been revoked, the owner of said business
can do only those things that would be normal and incidental to the closure of
said business.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.12 DISPLAY OF CERTIFICATE.
   The licenses provided for in this article shall be evidenced by license
certificates. The holder of a license shall display the license certificate in
a prominent place at the location of the licensed activity or device, and shall
make the license certificate available for inspection by City police, the Code
Enforcement Officer, the City Treasurer or his designated agent.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.13  FEES FOR TRADES, PROFESSIONS, OCCUPATIONS, AND BUSINESS ACTIVITIES.
   The fee for certain Trades, professions, Occupations and Business activities
license shall be five dollars ($5.00) imposed, on an annual basis for each
business or profession operating within the City, not required to get a new
license if going from a partnership to a corporation. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-
28-02.)
761.14 FEES FOR OWNING AND OPERATING COIN-OPERATED AMUSEMENT DEVICES OR VENDING
MACHINES.
   (a)   Persons and/or business owning and operating coin-operated
merchandise, service, amusement or music devices or vending machines shall
obtain annual licenses and pay the fees prescribed in this section.
   (b)   The liability for the license to operate any type of coin-operated
merchandise, service, amusement or music devices or vending machines shall be
upon the owner of the machine. The ownership shall be established by either a
bill of sale, paid invoice or a conditional sales contract, which has been
recorded in the applicable County Clerk’s Office. The leasing of such a machine
shall not be considered as a transfer of ownership of the machine and where a
lessor- lessee relationship exists, the lessor shall be liable for the
applicable license and fees.
   (c)   The annual license fee to own and operate a coin operated baggage or
parcel checking machine or device which is used for the storage of baggage or
parcels of any character, to own and operate any coin operated toilet locker or
device, to own and operate any coin operated amusement or music device, to own
and operate a coin operated merchandise or service device, or nay other type of
device which is operated on the coin-in-the-slot principle shall be five
dollars ($5.00).
   (d)   No license fee shall be required of stores or businesses owning and
operating machines or devices described in this section and owned by them in
their own licensed stores. Provided however, that where the principal business
is the operation of the machines or devices, then the licenses shall be
obtained as above.
   (e)   The provisions of this section shall not be applicable to any pay
telephone, postage stamp vending machines or currency changing machines
operated on the coin-in-the-slot principle, unless it’s another governmental
entity or public utility utilizing vending machines. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-
02.)
761.15 CONSTRUCTION; SEVERABILITY.
   The provisions of this article shall be construed so as to make them
consistent with State law and consistent with the correlative statutes provided
for State licensing fees. If any section or sections of this article shall,
even when so construed, be found to be in violation of the laws or
constitutions of the State or the United States, or shall be found to be an
attempted exercise of power not granted to the City, the resulting invalidity
of that section or those sections shall not mean the remaining sections of this
article shall not be enforced.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.16 FALSE STATEMENTS PROHIBITED.
   No person shall knowingly make any false statement in any application for a
City license provided for in this article, or in any report or other statement
relating to any activity licensed by the City and which is required to be made
to any City officer or agency.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.17 PROSECUTION; INJUNCTIONS.
   If any person engages in or prosecutes any business, activity, trade or
employment contrary to any of the provisions of this Code, whether without
first obtaining a license therefor or by continuing the same after the
termination of the effective period of such license, or by any violation of the
terms and conditions of such license, he shall be subject to immediate
prosecution in the Municipal Court and, in addition, the City Attorney may, in
the name of the City, seek such injunctive relief as may be appropriate in any
court of competent jurisdiction. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.18 EFFECTIVE DATE.
   This article shall take effect on July 1, 2002.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.19 REGISTRATION OF NONLICENSED BUSINESSES.
   Any person undertaking any other business activity not licensed under this
article shall be required annually to make application to and to register with,
the City Treasurer on such forms as he shall prescribe.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.20 REVOCATION.
   Any license may be revoked by the City Treasurer for any violation by the
licensee of any provision of this article. Such revocation may be in addition
to any fine imposed.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.21  REGULATIONS.
   The City Treasurer may, from time to time, as he deems necessary, establish,
promulgate and implement any rules and regulations necessary to effectuate the
provisions of this article. (Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
761.22 GENERAL REQUIREMENTS.
   In addition to any requirement set out elsewhere in this article:
   (a)   West Virginia Business Registration Franchise Certificate. Prior to
the issuance of any Municipal Business License under this article, the
applicant shall submit to the City Treasurer/Finance Director a valid current
West Virginia Business Registration Franchise Certificate. No municipal
business license may be issued until this document has been received by the
City Treasurer/Finance Director.
   (b)   Stormwater. Prior to the issuance of any Municipal Business License
under this article, any applicant engaged in the business of construction, or
as a construction contractor, demolition, landscaping, lawn maintenance and/or
lawn care shall submit to the City Treasurer/Finance Director valid and current
certification or proof that the applicant, or an agent thereof, has passed the
City of Vienna or Vienna Utility Board Stormwater Certification Course. No
municipal business license may be issued until documentation has been provided
to the City Treasurer/Finance Director.
   (c)   Stormwater Certification is valid for two years from the date the
Stormwater Certification test or exam is passed. (Ord. 06-15. Passed 5-28-15.)
761.99 PENALTY.
   (a)   Whoever engages in any activity contrary to the provisions of this
article, whether without obtaining a license required before commencing the
same or by continuing the same after the termination of the effective period of
any such license, may, in addition to paying the license tax, be liable for a
penalty of fifty dollars ($50.00) for each month or fraction thereof during
which he has been in default of the license tax. It shall be the duty of the
City Treasurer to collect the full amount of the license tax and penalty
imposed and he shall not issue any license until the license tax and the
penalty have been paid in full.
   (b)   In addition to the foregoing and except as may herein be otherwise
expressly provided, whoever violates any provision under this article shall be
fined not less than fifty dollars ($50.00) nor more than five hundred dollars
($500.00) and/or each day or part thereof that any violation continues shall be
deemed to constitute a distinct and separate offense and be punishable
accordingly.
   (c)   Whoever knowingly makes a false statement in any license tax
application shall be fined not less than five hundred dollars ($500.00) nor
more than one thousand dollars ($1000.00). Each false statement, whether made
with or without other false statements on any one application shall constitute
a separate offense.
(Ord. 0-1-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
ARTICLE 765
Outdoor Advertising
 
765.01   Purpose.
765.02   Definitions.
765.03   Permitted districts.
765.04   Legal nonconforming signs.
765.05   General provisions.
765.06   Size of signs.
765.07   Height of signs.
765.08   Setback requirements.
765.09   Spacing.
765.10   Lighting.
765.11   Type of sign structure.
765.12   Sign permits.
765.13   Prohibited signs, etc.; removal at owner’s expense.
765.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Traffic control device on - see TRAF.
313.06
Parks - see S.U. & P.S.
951.17
 
 
765.01 PURPOSE.
   (a)   This article establishes the regulations for the continuing use of
outdoor advertising in order to encourage an attractive environment for
businesses, inform and direct the general public, protect and enhance the
physical appearance of the community, ensure public safety along streets and
highways, and provide business with a format for advertising the goods and
services made available by the business community.
   (b)   Outdoor advertising is a traditional and legitimate advertising medium
involving the lawful use of private property.
   (c)   Outdoor advertising should be regulated to provide for safe
structures, to be properly located so as to meet uniform standards for
construction and maintenance, and to be maintained to conform to a neat and
pleasant community appearance.
   (d)   In support of the previous statements and in order to assure the
compatibility of off- premise (billboard) signs with surrounding land usage, to
enhance the economy of the City, to protect the public interest in streets and
highways, to promote and maintain the safety and general welfare of persons and
their property in the vicinity of outdoor advertising structures, to allow
property owners the opportunity to sell or lease their properties for outdoor
advertising uses, and to provide and protect tax revenues by promoting the
reasonable, orderly and effective display of outdoor advertising, it is deemed
to be in the public interest to enact this article. (Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-
02.)
765.02 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   “Advertising structure” means a sign which has a flat surface sign
space upon which advertising may be posted, painted or affixed, and which is
primarily designed for the rental or lease of such sign space for advertising
not relating to the use of the property upon which the sign exists.
      (1)   Bulletins: Standard sizes are as follows:
            14' H x 48' W
            10' H x 40' W
            10' 6" x 36' W
      (2)   Posters: Standard size is 12' x 3" H x 24' 6" W
   (b)   “Back-to-back sign” means an off-premise sign consisting of two sign
facings oriented in opposite directions with not more than two faces per sign
facing.
   (c)   “Billboard signs” is the common term for poster panels and bulletins.
   (d)   “Directional sign” means a sign erected for the convenience of the
public, such as for directing traffic movement, parking, or identifying
restrooms, public telephones, walkways and other similar features or
facilities, and bearing no advertising message.
   (e)   “Doubled faced sign” means an off-premise sign with two adjacent faces
oriented in the same direction and not more than 10 feet apart at the nearest
point between the two faces.
   (f)   “Embellishment” means add-ons to the structure that extend beyond the
standard structure area to command greater attention to the message. Can
include letters, packages, 3-D elements.
   (g)   “Facing” means that portion of an off-premise sign upon which
advertising is affixed or painted and visible in one direction at one time.
   (h)   “Official sign” means a sign erected by a governmental agency or its
designee, setting forth information pursuant to law.
   (i)   “Off-premise outdoor advertising sign” means a sign, including the
supporting sign structure, which is visible from a street or highway and
advertises goods or services not located on the premises and/or property upon
which the sign is located; also called a “billboard”. The following shall not
be considered an off-premise sign for the purposes of this article:
      (1)   Directional or official signs authorized by law.
      (2)   Real estate signs.
      (3)   On-premise signs.
   (j)   “Real estate sign” means a sign which advertises the sale or lease of
the property upon which the sign is located.
   (k)   “Roof mounted sign” means an off-premise sign attached to the roof of
a building.
   (l)   “V type sign” means an off-premise sign structure which consists of
multiple sign facings placed at angles to each other, oriented in different
directions and not exceeding 10 degrees apart at the nearest point to each
other from center line of structure. Not to exceed 20 degrees at furthest
point. See Attachment A.
   (m)   “Wall sign” means an off-premise sign attached to the wall of a
building or structure. (Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.03 PERMITTED DISTRICTS.
   Off-premise signs (billboards) shall be a permitted use within the
commercial district.
(Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.04 LEGAL NONCONFORMING SIGNS.
   (a)   Any off-premise sign lawfully erected and in existence as of the
effective date of this article which does not meet the requirements of this
article may be maintained as a matter of right as a legal nonconforming sign.
   (b)   Any non-conforming off-premise (billboard) sign that would be removed
or any destruction of the structure with replacement cost of fifty percent
(50%) or more, shall adhere to the applicable zoning-sign ordinance for the
said zoning district.
   (c)   Nothing in this section shall be deemed to prevent the strengthening
or the restoration to a safe condition any off-premise (billboard) sign or part
thereof, declared to be unsafe by the Code Enforcement Division official.
(Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.05 GENERAL PROVISIONS.
   (a)   No off-premise (billboard) sign shall be constructed which resembles
any official marker erected by a governmental entity, or which by reason of
position, shape, or color would conflict with the proper functioning of any
official traffic control device.
   (b)   Off-premise (billboard) signs shall be constructed in accordance with
City and State building and electrical codes and shall be subject to wind and
snow loads as set forth in the latest edition of the BOCA building codes. All
plans shall have a structural engineer’s seal/stamp with the engineer’s
signature.
   (c)   All plans shall be submitted with a site plan or legal survey showing
the perimeter, the exact location of the proposed sign on the site, and the
distances from all property lines of the farthest point of the sign.
   (d)   Off-premise (billboard) signs shall be regularly maintained in good
and safe structural condition.
   (e)   Any advertisement poster on said off-premise (billboard) sign for a
special event, shall be removed within thirty days from the ending date of said
event. If the removal of the poster creates an unsightly view, a generic, white
poster shall be installed.
(Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.06 SIZE OF SIGNS.
   (a)   The total facing(s) shall be 672 square feet, excluding an
embellishment which shall not exceed twenty percent (20%) of the maximum sign
area allowed.
   (b)   The sign area shall be measured by the smallest square, circle,
rectangle, or combination thereof which will encompass the entire sign face.
   (c)   Signs shall be single faced or V Type signs and meet the size
requirements. Double stacked signs shall not be permitted.
   (d)   The embellishment shall extend not more than five and one-half feet
(5-1/2') above the top molding or two feet from the bottom or side molding of
such sign.
(Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.07 HEIGHT OF SIGNS.
   An off-premise sign shall have a maximum height not to exceed forty feet
above grade level of the roadway to the top of the structure, as measured from
the centerline of the roadway to which the sign is oriented. Minimum eight feet
clearance to bottom of sign.
(Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.08 SETBACK REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   Front. A minimum setback of twenty-five feet is required from front
lot line for any off-premise sign, regardless of zone.
   (b)   Side. A minimum setback of five feet on each side is required from
side lot line for any off-premise sign, regardless of zone.
   (c)   Rear. A minimum setback of five feet is required from rear lot line
for any off- premise sign, regardless of zone.
   (d)   Street Intersection. A minimum setback of thirty feet from all rights
of way of any street. (Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.09 SPACING.
   (a)   No off-premise sign shall be constructed within 1,000 feet measured
from all directions of any other off-premise sign if in line of sight.
   (b)   Spacing from Directional and Official signs, on-premise signs or any
sign which does not constitute an off-premise sign shall not be counted nor
shall measurements be made from such signs for the purpose of determining
compliance with these spacing requirements.
   (c)   No off-premise sign shall be permitted within 400 feet from any
residential zoning district within a C-1 zoning district.
   (d)   The minimum distance between off-premise signs shall be measured along
the nearest edge of the pavement between points directly opposite the center of
the signs along each side of the highway or street.
   (e)   No off-premise sign shall be permitted within 500 feet from each
property line of a public recreation facility, park, school, or church,
regardless of the zoning district.
(Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.10 LIGHTING.
   Off-premise signs may be illuminated subject to the following restrictions:
   (a)   Signs must be effectively shielded to prevent beams or rays from being
directed toward any portion of the traveled ways, and must not be of such
intensity or brilliance to cause glare or impair the vision of the driver of
any motor vehicle or otherwise interfere with any driver’s operation of a motor
vehicle.
   (b)   No sign shall be so illuminated that it interferes with the
effectiveness of or obscures an official traffic sign, device or signal.
   (c)   No flashing, intermittent or moving lights are permitted.
(Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.11  TYPE OF SIGN STRUCTURE.
   All advertising structures shall be of the unipole (single pole) style
constructed of steel. The structure shall be sealed with a solid earthtone
color.
(Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.12 SIGN PERMITS.
   No off-premise sign shall be erected without first securing a zoning permit,
a construction permit and all applicable fees are paid. Before such zoning
permit is issued, an on-site inspection shall be made to determine that the
proposed off-premise sign complies with all provisions of this article. (Ord.
0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)
765.13  PROHIBITED SIGN, ETC.; REMOVAL AT OWNER’S EXPENSE.
   No person shall paint, mark, post, tack, nail or otherwise affix any sign,
advertisement, notice, picture, drawing, emblem, poster, printing, or writing,
other than those placed and maintained in pursuance of law, on or to any stone,
rock, tree, fence, stump, post, pole, building or other structure, which is in
or upon the right-of-way of any public road or highway, including the road,
median or highway itself, except that the City of Vienna may provide for
suitable road signs, danger signals and other signs of informational nature. No
such sign or other marking shall be suspended over the right-of-way of any
public road or highway. (Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28- 02.)
765.99 PENALTY.
   Any person violating this section, whether as principal, agent, or employee,
shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and, upon conviction thereof, shall be
punished by a fine of not less than twenty-five dollars ($25.00) nor more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00); and such person shall be deemed guilty of a
separate offense for each day during any portion of which any violation of this
section is committed or continued. Every such prohibited sign or other marking
is hereby declared to be a public nuisance. Upon receiving notice of any
violation of this section, the Mayor shall cause the prohibited sign or other
marking to be removed within ten days and shall cause the appearance of the
property on which it was affixed to be restored, as near as may be practicable,
to its condition immediately before such violation occurred. The Mayor shall,
in the name of the City of Vienna, recover from the persons who hereafter
violate this section the amounts expended by the City of Vienna in removing the
sign or other marking and in restoring the appearance of the property on which
it was affixed.
(Ord. 0-2-02. Passed 2-28-02.)

CODIFIED ORDINANCES OF VIENNA
PART NINE - STREETS, UTILITIES AND PUBLIC SERVICES CODE

ARTICLE 905
Excavations
 
905.01   Application.
905.02   Cost.
905.03   Sewer tap excavations.
905.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Authority to regulate - see W. Va. Code 8-12-5(2)
Sewer extensions - see S.U. & P.S. Art.
933
 
 
905.01 APPLICATION.
   No person shall dig in or break any street, sidewalk, curb or pavement or
make any excavation beneath the surface of any street, sidewalk or pavement of
the City.
   If any person desires to have any such digging or breaking effected, he
shall apply to the City to have the work done for and on his behalf. Such
application shall be in writing and shall state that the applicant will bear
all of the cost and expense incident to the digging or breaking desired. The
application shall be filed, in writing, with the City Recorder who shall
forthwith deliver the application to the Director of Public Works. The digging
and breaking shall thereupon be made by the City under the supervision of the
Director.
(1965 Code §18-5)
905.02 COST.
   The Director of Public Works at the completion of any work done pursuant to
the provisions of Section
905.01, shall compute the entire cost of the work, including all labor and all
materials required in the excavation. Immediately upon the completion of the
computation, the applicant shall pay to the City such entire cost. The Director
of Public Works shall not fill any excavation until the costs have been paid by
the applicant.
(1965 Code §18-6)
905.03 SEWER TAP EXCAVATIONS.
   The provisions of Sections
905.01 and
905.02 do not apply to an excavation for the purpose of making a sewer tap.
(1965 Code §18-7)
905.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: See Section
101.99 for general Codified Ordinance penalty.)
ARTICLE 907
Trees

907.19    Abuse or mutilation of trees.
907.20    Placing materials on public property.

907.01 SHORT TITLE.
   This article shall be known and may be cited as the Vienna Tree Ordinance.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.02 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   “Street Trees” means trees, shrubs, bushes, and all other woody
vegetation on land lying between property lines on either side of all streets,
avenues, and ways within the City of Vienna. Streets, avenues and ways means
the entire width of every public way or right-of-way when any part thereof is
open to the use of the public, as a matter of right, for purposes of vehicular
and pedestrian traffic and extending from property line to property line. The
City of Vienna shall assume responsibility for maintenance and removal of trees
on public right-of-ways only for trees the City of Vienna has planted,
subsequent to the adoption of this ordinance, provided however, that nothing
contained in this ordinance shall create any liability upon the city or result
in a civil action against the city by any person for damage to property or
persons.
   (b)   “Park Trees” means trees, shrubs, bushes, and all other woody
vegetation on or in public parks and all areas owned by the City, or to which
the public has free access as a park.
   (c)   “Yard Trees” means trees, shrubs, bushes, and all other woody
vegetation now or hereafter growing on any private property in the City of
Vienna.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.03 STATEMENT OF OBJECTIVE.
   The objective of this article is to manage removal and replacement of trees
within the City of Vienna. To monitor species, to provide for the aesthetic
quality of the Cityscape and to provide for citizen protection by controlling
tree growth, size and condition within the limits of the City of Vienna.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.04 CREATION OF A VIENNA TREE AND BEAUTIFICATION COMMISSION.
   (a)   There is hereby created and established a Vienna Tree and
Beautification Commission for the City of Vienna. All members, except as set
out below, shall be appointed and approved by the Mayor and which shall consist
of not more than eleven (11) members.
   All members shall be residents of the City of Vienna.
      (1)   One member shall be the Mayor or his/her designee.
      (2)   One member shall be the City Forester. In the event the City does
not have a City Forester, this position may be filled by a resident of the City
of Vienna.
      (3)   EXCEPTION: The residence requirement may be waived for any person
who offers a skill or possesses knowledge that may be beneficial to furthering
the goals and objectives of the Tree and Beautification Commission; or for any
person who is employed by the City of Vienna or the Vienna Utility Board; or
owns or operates a business in the corporate limits of the City of Vienna.
   (b)   Attendance. In the event that a member of the Commission fails to
attend three consecutive regular Commission meetings, with the exception of the
Mayor or his/her designee, or the Vienna Council Representative or his/her
designee, or the City Forester, said Commissioner may, upon vote of the
remaining Commissioners, be removed from the Commission and relieved from his/
her duties. Upon removal, the Mayor shall, in accord with Section
 907.05 of the Vienna Municipal Ordinances, appoint a new member to fill the
remaining term.
(Ord. 08-19. Passed 12-12-19.)
   (c)   The Tree and Beautification Commission shall:
      (1)   Develop a master plan for the beautification of the City of Vienna
community.
      (2)   Review suggestions for projects.
      (3)   Develop guidelines for funding projects or awarding grants.
      (4)   Develop a plan and make recommendations to the City Council.
      (5)   Make goal-based recommendations regarding code enforcement, zoning,
and public works projects.
      (6)   Encourage private investment and volunteer involvement.
      (7)   Establish awards and recognition programs as appropriate to
recognize achievement in the beautification of the City.
      (8)   Advise and consult with the forester on any matter pertaining to
Article
907 including, but not limited to, setting policy concerning selection,
planting,
maintenance and removal of trees shrubs and other plants within the City.
      (9)   Allocate funds to arboricultural activity and expenditures of such
funds.
      (10)   Establish educational and informational programs.
      (11)   Development of policies and procedures regarding the Foresters
duties and the issuance of permits required by this Chapter.
         (Ord. 0-3-13. Passed 5-9-13.)
907.05 TERM OF OFFICE.
   The term of the eight (8) members of the Vienna Tree and Beautification
Commission appointed by the Mayor of the City of Vienna shall be four (4)
years. (Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14- 98.)
907.06 DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES.
   It shall be the responsibility of the Vienna Tree and Beautification
Commission to study, investigate, council and develop and/or update annually
and administer a written plan for the care preservation, pruning, planting,
replanting, removal or disposition of trees and shrubs in parks, along streets
and in other public areas. Such a plan will be presented annually to the City
Council and upon their acceptance and approval shall constitute the official
Comprehensive City Tree Plan for the City of Vienna, West Virginia.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.07 OPERATION.
   (a)   The Vienna Tree and Beautification Commission shall choose its own
officers. They should consist of a Chairperson, Vice-Chairperson, Secretary,
and other officers as may be needed.
   (b)   The Commission shall make its own rules and regulations and keep a
journal of its proceedings. A majority of members present shall be a quorum for
the transaction of business.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.08 STREET TREES AND PARK TREES SPECIES TO BE PLANTED.
   The following list is the current official Suggested Street Tree and Park
Tree Species List for the City of Vienna, West Virginia.
   No species other then those included on this list may be planted as street
trees or park trees without written permission of the Vienna Tree and
Beautification Commission.
OFFICIAL SUGGESTED STREET TREE AND PARK TREE SPECIES LIST
STREET AND PARK TREES                  PARK AND YARD TREES
(Less than 30' Mature                  (30' to 50' Mature

Common Name             Shape          Common Name            Shape
Arborvitae              Pyramidal      Ash, European Mountain Pyramidal
Cherry, Oriental        Upright        Ash, Green             Oval/Upright
Cherry, Sargent         Columnar       Corktree, Amur         Oval
Cherry, Yoshino                       Ginko (males only)     Pyramidal

(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.09 SPACING.
   The spacing of street trees will be in acceptance with the three species
size classes on the official Suggested Street Tree Species List following this
article, and no trees may be planted closer together than the following:
 
Small Trees       25 feet
Medium Trees    30 feet
Large Trees       50 feet
   Except in special planting designed or approved by a landscape architect for
the Vienna Tree and Beautification Commission.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.10 DISTANCE FROM CURBS AND SIDEWALKS.
   No street tree shall be planted, or an existing tree maintained at, or near
an intersection that does not permit a clear view for vehicular traffic down a
side street or alley from said intersection measured along the curb line. No
street trees shall be planted closer than ten (10) feet away from any fire
hydrant.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.11 UTILITIES.
   No street trees other than those species listed as "Small Trees" on the
official Suggested Street Tree List following this article may be planted
within ten (10) lateral feet of any known underground water line, sewer line,
transmission line or other utility.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.12 PUBLIC TREE CARE.
   (a)   The City of Vienna Tree and Beautification Commission shall have the
right to plant, prune, maintain and remove trees, plants and shrubs within the
lines of all streets, avenues, alleys, lanes, squares, and public grounds, as
may be necessary to insure public safety, preserve or enhance the symmetry and
beauty of such public grounds.
   (b)   The Commission may remove or cause or order to be removed any tree or
pan thereof which is in an unsafe condition or which by reason of its own
nature is injurious to sewers, electric power lines, gas lines, water lines, or
other public improvements, or is affected with any injurious fungus, insect, or
other pest. This section does not prohibit the planting of street trees by
adjacent property owners providing that the selection and location of said
trees are in accordance with the official Suggested Street Tree List and
Sections
907.08 through
907.11.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.13 IMPROPER PLANTING.
   Whenever any tree shall be planted or transplanted in conflict with the
provisions of this article; it shall be lawful for the City of Vienna Tree and
Beautification Commission to remove or cause removal of the same, and the exact
cost thereof may be assessed to and paid by the person responsible for the
improper planting of such tree.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.14 NEW VIENNA BUSINESSES AND NON-SINGLE FAMILY DWELLINGS.
   It shall be the responsibility of the owners of new businesses and non-
single family dwellings to submit to the Vienna Tree and Beautification
Commission a comprehensive landscape design. The design for trees and shrubs
should include species, size, age, their location, and relation to major
utilities. This design must be approved by the Commission prior to planting.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.15 REMOVAL, REPLANTING AND REPLACEMENT.
   (a)   Whenever it is necessary to remove a tree or trees in connection with
the paving of a sidewalk, or the paving or widening of a portion of a street
used for vehicular traffic, the City will replant such trees or replace them.
If it is impractical to replant in the same area, the Vienna Tree and
Beautification Commission will designate an appropriate location for planting
the replacement tree or trees.
   (b)   No person or property owner shall remove a tree from the City right-
of-way for the purpose of construction, or for any other reason, without
replacing the removed tree or trees in accordance with the adopted
Comprehensive City Tree Plan. Such replacement shall meet the standards of
size, species, and placement as provided by the Vienna Tree and Beautification
Commission. The person or property owner shall bear the cost of removal and
replacement of all trees so removed and replaced.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)  
907.16 TREE TOPPING.
   It shall be unlawful as a normal practice for any person or firm, to top any
street tree or other tree on public property. Topping is defined as the severe
cutting back of limbs to stubs, larger than three (3) inches within the tree's
crown to such a degree so as to remove the normal canopy and disfigure the
tree. Trees severely damaged by storms or other causes, or certain trees under
utility wires or other obstructions where pruning practices are impractical,
may be exempted from this article by determination of the Vienna Tree and
Beautification Commission.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.17 PRUNING OF TREES AND SHRUBS OBSTRUCTING VIEWS.
   (a)   It shall be the duty of any person or person owning or occupying real
property abutting on any street, avenue or alley way upon whose property there
are Yard Trees or Shrubs, to prune those trees or shrubs in such a manner that
they will not shade or obstruct the street lamps, obstruct the passage of
pedestrians on sidewalks, obstruct vision of traffic signs, obstruct vehicular
traffic or obstruct the view of any intersection. The minimum clearance of any
overhanging portion thereof shall be eight (8) feet over sidewalks and fourteen
(14) feet over all streets, avenues and alley ways.
   (b)   Said owners shall remove all dead, decayed or dangerous trees or
broken or decayed limbs which constitute a menace to the safety of the public.
The City shall have the right to prune any tree or shrub on private property
where it interferes with the proper spread of light along the street from a
street lamp or interferes with visibility or any traffic control device or
sign.
   (c)   This section shall not be construed to require private property owners
to prune, remove or otherwise maintain trees located on town owned property or
easements.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)  
907.18 DEAD OR DISEASED TREE REMOVAL ON PRIVATE PROPERTY.
   (a)   The Vienna Tree and Beautification Commission, or the City, shall have
the right to cause the removal of any dead, dying, diseased or structurally
unsound trees on public or private property within the City limits, when such
trees constitute a hazard to the public, health, safety, and welfare. (Ord. 06-
2020. Passed 9-24-20.)
   (b)   This authority includes, but is not limited to, trees that otherwise
are on private property but overhang or otherwise protrude into public rights
of way, streets, roads, highways, sidewalks, paths, and/or public utility
lines.
   (c)   Further, this authority extends to and includes trees that may
protrude into or otherwise affect an adjacent right of way, including
underground utility lines, cables, pipes, or wires, such that it affects the
use of the right of way in such a fashion as to pose a danger to the public
health, safety, and welfare - including, but not limited to, damaging or having
the potential to damage sewage lines, pipes, gas lines, electricity lines, and
the like.
   (d)   The Commission or the City will notify in writing the owners of such
trees. Tree removal, trimming, cutting and/or pruning, may be done by the owner
at his or her own expense within thirty (30) days after the date of service of
written notice. In the event of failure of the owner to comply with such
provisions, the City shall have the authority to remove such trees and charge
the cost of removal to the owner including the filing of a lien in the amount
of the cost of the tree removal.
(Ord. 11-14. Passed 9-25-14.)
907.19 ABUSE OR MUTILATION OF TREES.
   Unless specifically authorized by the Vienna Tree and Beautification
Commission or the City, no person shall damage, cut, carve, transplant or
remove any street trees or park trees; attach any rope, wire, nails,
advertising posters, or other contrivance to any tree, allow any gaseous liquid
or solid substance which is harmful to such trees, to come in contact with
them; or set fire or permit any fire to burn when such fire or heat thereof
will injure any portion of said tree.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.20 PLACING MATERIALS ON PUBLIC PROPERTY.
   No person shall deposit, place, store or maintain upon any public property
of the municipality, any stone, brick, sand, concrete, or other materials which
may impede the free passage of water, air and fertilizer to the roots of any
tree growing therein, except by written permit of the Vienna Tree and
Beautification Commission of the City.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)  
907.21 REMOVAL OF STUMPS.
   All stumps of street and park trees shall be removed below the surface of
the ground so that the top of the stump shall not project above the surface of
the ground. Either (8) inches is the recommended depth.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
 
907.22 INTERFERENCE WITH COMMISSION.
   It shall be unlawful for any person to prevent, delay or interfere with the
Vienna Tree and Beautification Commission, or any of its agents, while engaging
in and about the planting, cultivating, mulching, pruning, spraying or removing
of any street trees, park trees or yard trees as authorized in this article.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.23 REVIEW BY CITY COUNCIL.
   The Vienna City Council shall have the right to review the conduct, acts and
decisions of the Vienna Tree and Beautification Commission. Any person may
appeal from any ruling or order of the Vienna Tree Commission to the Vienna
City Council who may hear the matter and make the final decision.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.24 SEVERABILITY.
   If any provisions of this article shall be declared invalid or
unconstitutional by any court of competent jurisdiction, such declaration shall
not invalidate any other provisions of this article. The City of Vienna hereby
declares that they have adopted each and every portion of this article
separately regardless of the possible invalidity of any part thereof.
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
907.99 PENALTY.
   Any person, firm or corporation violating or failing to comply with any of
the provisions of this article shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon
conviction thereof shall be fined a sum of not less than twenty dollars
($20.00) and not more than five hundred dollars ($500.00).
(Ord. 9-98. Passed 5-14-98.)
ARTICLE 909
Construction and Repair of Sidewalks
 
909.01    Permit required.
909.02    Requirements generally.
909.03    Duty of owner of abutting property.
909.04    Inspection; notice.
909.05    Failure to comply.
909.06      Manner of serving notice to repair sidewalk for nonresident owners
with no agent in the City.
909.07      Program for shared repair and relaying of sidewalks and curbs
abutting residential properties.
909.99    Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Low cost improvements - see W. Va. Code Art. 8-17
Sidewalk assessments - see W. Va. Code Art. 8-18
 
 
909.01 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person shall construct any sidewalk or footway along and beside any
street within the City without first obtaining a permit for the construction
from the Director of Public Works. (1965 Code §18-8)
909.02 REQUIREMENTS GENERALLY.
   All sidewalks or footways hereafter constructed along and beside any street
in the City shall:
   (a)   Be of uniform width with other sidewalks of the street and in no event
to be less than four feet in width.
   (b)   Be constructed of concrete material unless permission is given by
Council for the use of some other material.
   (c)   Be constructed so that the inside line of the sidewalk is the outside
line of the lot abutting on the street where the sidewalk is constructed, or
constructed on a line as plotted by the City Engineer and adopted by Council.
   (d)   Be constructed on a line with all other sidewalks along the street and
free of offsets and steps and on the same grade with the street and curb along
which the sidewalk is constructed.
   (e)   Be at a minimum depth of four inches.
(Ord. 10-14. Passed 8-14-14.)
909.03 DUTY OF OWNER OF ABUTTING PROPERTY.
   The owner and occupant of the property abutting upon any sidewalk or footway
in the City shall keep the same in a condition of good repair and free and
clean.
(1965 Code §18-10)
909.04 INSPECTION; NOTICE.
   The Director of Public Works shall inspect sidewalks and footways along the
streets of the City and whenever any such sidewalk or footway is not in a good
condition of repair or does not meet the requirements as to the manner of
construction in material and width and other requirements stated in Sections
909.01 and
909.02, the Director shall report the same to the Mayor and Council, who shall
then give ten days' notice in writing to the owner of the property abutting on
the faulty sidewalk or footway, to repair or rebuild the sidewalk, which notice
shall be in the following form and words:
 
   "To __________________
   Please take notice that the sidewalk along                              Street and along which your property abuts is defective in the following respects:
                                                                                             
                                                                                             
   Please be notified further that unless you correct said defects and construct said sidewalk in accordance with the requirements of the ordinances of the City of Vienna within a period
of ten days from the date hereof, the said City shall cause said defects in said sidewalk to be corrected and the cost of correcting said defects shall be assessed against your property.
                                                                
            Mayor"
(1965 Code §18-11.)
909.05 FAILURE TO COMPLY.
   In the event that the property owner, whose abutting sidewalk or footway is
defective, fails to improve or repair the sidewalk or footway within ten days
after service of the notice mentioned in Section
909.04, then Council shall cause the sidewalk or footway to be repaired,
constructed or improved and assess the amount of the expense thereof upon the
owner or occupant.
   The provisions of this section shall be in addition to any other remedy or
penalty provided for the violation of this article.
(1965 Code §18-12)
909.06 MANNER OF SERVING NOTICE TO REPAIR SIDEWALK FOR NONRESIDENT OWNERS WITH
NO AGENT IN THE CITY.
   Where Council has determined that a curb, sidewalk, or footway needs repair
or replacement and the sidewalk, footway, or curb is adjacent to or abutting
property owned by a nonresident owner with no known agent in the City, such
notice, in the form set out in Section
909.04 of this Article, may be given by Class II legal notice in a newspaper
circulated in the City.
(Ord. 02-2023. Passed 1-12-23.)
909.07 PROGRAM FOR SHARED REPAIR AND RELAYING OF SIDEWALKS AND CURBS ABUTTING
RESIDENTIAL PROPERTIES.
   (a)   The City may provide by resolution a program to aid residential
property owners in repairing and relaying sidewalks, footways, and curbs along
City Streets within the residential districts of the City of Vienna. Should the
City appropriate funds in a fiscal year for the implementation of said program,
it shall be implemented as follows:
      (1)   All residential property owners participating in such program shall
be required to pay all costs of materials utilized in the repair or relaying of
the sidewalks and curbs abutting their property.
      (2)   The City of Vienna shall bear all associated labor costs.
      (3)   The participation of residential property owners in such program
shall be voluntary.
      (4)   The City shall conduct such program as a City project as, when, and
if funds become or are made available.
      (5)   All fees owed to the City of Vienna or the Vienna Utility Board in
the property owner's name must be paid in full to qualify for the sidewalk
program. (Ord. 02-2023. Passed 1-12-23.)
909.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
101.99 for general Codified Ordinances penalty.)

905.01,
